decks.notes: The key strategy of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while efficiently controlling the board with counterspells and removal spells. The deck includes powerful disruption like Force of Will and Force of Negation, as well as versatile removal options such as Fatal Push and Orcish Bowmasters. The addition of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for constant recursion of key threats or disruption pieces. With efficient card draw and library manipulation like Brainstorm and Ponder, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and ultimately control the game until victory.

This Vintage 1 vs 1 Combo - Doomsday deck is built around assembling and casting the Doomsday spell to set up a winning combination of cards for victory. The deck focuses on efficient and powerful cards such as Gitaxian Probe, Force of Will, and Ponder to help find and protect the key combo pieces. With powerful tutors like Vampiric Tutor and Demonic Consultation, along with cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder, the deck aims to quickly assemble the necessary pieces to win the game using cards like Thassa's Oracle or Dig Through Time.

The deck focuses on a unique combo utilizing Balustrade Spy and Undercity Informer to mill the library and trigger Thassa's Oracle to win the game instantly. The deck runs a high number of artifact mana accelerants and card draw spells to quickly assemble the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Force of Will and Cabal Therapy. The inclusion of Living Wish allows for access to silver bullet cards from the sideboard when needed, while Karn, the Great Creator provides additional utility and disruption. The game plan revolves around executing the combo as efficiently as possible while protecting it with counter magic.

The deck focuses on assembling powerful artifacts and leveraging them with spells like Paradoxical Outcome to generate card advantage and combo off for a win. Key cards like Coveted Jewel, Grim Monolith, and The One Ring enable explosive plays, while Force of Will and Sink into Stupor provide disruption and control. The deck aims to power out fast mana with cards like Mishra's Workshop and Moxen to cast game-winning spells like Tinker for powerful artifacts like Time Vault and The One Ring, ultimately leading to victory through a synergistic artifact combo strategy.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly generate mana through powerful artifacts like Black Lotus and Moxen, while controlling the board with counterspells like Force of Will. The combo potential lies in utilizing Paradoxical Outcome to return and replay multiple artifacts, drawing into more resources and setting up a game-winning play. Lurrus of the Dream-Den serves as a versatile companion, providing additional value and recursion options. With efficient card draw, mana acceleration, and disruptive elements, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and create a winning advantage through its synergy and combo potential.

This deck focuses on using artifacts and artifact creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. The key strategy involves ramping up mana quickly using powerful mana acceleration cards like Sol Ring and Ancient Tomb, while also utilizing powerful artifacts like The One Ring and Grim Monolith to generate a strong board presence. Karn, the Great Creator adds additional versatility by being able to shut down opponent's artifacts while also providing a win condition with the Time Vault combo. The deck aims to quickly establish dominance on the battlefield and win before the opponent can recover.

This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while deploying aggressive creatures to apply pressure and close out games quickly. By utilizing hatebear creatures like Anointed Peacekeeper, Archon of Emeria, and Chancellor of the Annex, the deck can slow down the opponent's spells and prevent them from executing their game plan effectively. The inclusion of cards like Void Mirror and Wasteland further disrupt the opponent's mana base, while Seasoned Dungeoneer and White Plume Adventurer provide card advantage and help maintain pressure on the opponent.(Frame vintage 1 vs 1, Aggro - Hatebear archetype)

This Doomsday combo deck aims to quickly assemble a winning card pile using powerful card selection and mana acceleration to set up a game-winning play. The deck includes a variety of tutors and card draw spells to find key combo pieces like Doomsday and Thassa's Oracle, along with disruption like Force of Will to protect the combo. By carefully managing resources and planning out the perfect card pile, the deck can execute a game-winning sequence in a single turn, putting pressure on opponents to find answers quickly or face defeat.
